title: Implement RS validation code changes (SC-001, SC-002, CC-001 through CC-011)

comment: FINDING: Document scope (Section 2.2, line 26) claims 'Two structural changes (SC-001, SC-002)' but Change Description (Section 5) only documents SC-001. No Section 5.x explicitly describes SC-002. The SDLC namespace architecture appears split across CC-005 and CC-006 as code changes, but SC-002 as a structural change is not defined. This creates a traceability gap. REQUIRED CORRECTION: Either (1) add a dedicated SC-002 section in the Change Description explaining the SDLC namespace structural change, OR (2) revise the scope to accurately reflect that only SC-001 is a structural change and the namespace work is implemented via CC-005/CC-006.

Pre-review COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter title='Implement RS validation code changes (SC-001, SC-002, CC-001 through CC-011)', revision_summary='Initial draft' (valid for v0.x). (2) All 13 required sections present per SOP-002 Section 6. (3) SC-002 now properly documented in Section 5.2 with SDLC namespace architecture details including current/new state table and implementation references to CC-004, CC-005, CC-006. (4) Section 5 contains subsections 5.1-5.13 covering all scope items with full traceability. (5) No placeholder content in pre-approved sections 1-9. (6) No typos or formatting errors found. Document ready for pre-approval.

POST-EXECUTION REVIEW COMPLETE. FRONTMATTER VERIFIED: title='Implement RS validation code changes (SC-001, SC-002, CC-001 through CC-011)', revision_summary='Initial draft'. STRUCTURE: All 12 required sections present and complete. EXECUTION: All 7 EIs marked Pass with detailed execution notes. TEST EVIDENCE: 251 tests passed, 0 failed. DEVIATIONS: 4 deviations documented with rationale (qms_schema.py not modified, CC-003 no changes needed, cancel.py unplanned modification, additional files updated). PLACEHOLDERS: None found. TRACEABILITY: References CR-028, Session-2026-01-19-004, Session-2026-01-24-001, SOP-001, SOP-002. VERDICT: Document is procedurally compliant and execution is properly documented. Recommend approval.
